title: Lancaster Armory
text:
Lancaster Armory, also known as Brigadier General Charles P. Stahr Armory, is a historic <a href="National%20Guard%20%28United%20States%29">National Guard</a> <a href="armory%20%28military%29">armory</a> located at <a href="Lancaster%2C%20Pennsylvania">Lancaster</a>, <a href="Lancaster%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Lancaster County, Pennsylvania</a>. It is a "T"-shaped brick building consisting of a 3-story administration building built in 1937, with a 1 1/2-story drill hall built in 1928, executed in the <a href="Colonial%20Revival%20architecture">Colonial Revival</a> style. It measures approximately 90 feet by 200 feet. The building was <a href="Firebombing">firebombed</a> in 1982. The building once played host to the <a href="Lancaster%20Red%20Roses%20%28basketball%29">Lancaster Red Roses</a>. It was used as a public venue under the name The Stahr Center. Is currently the home of decades restaurant bar and arcade. In 2018 it was renovated and now houses Decades, a boutique bowling alley and retro-arcade.
It was added to the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1991.
